definitions: the action of entering or gaining access to an organization or place surreptitiously, especially in order to acquire secret information or cause damage

examples.text: the army fenced parts of the border in an effort to stop militant infiltration

shortDefinitions: action of entering or gaining access to organization or place surreptitiously

definitions: the spread of a tumor, cells, etc. into a tissue or organ

examples.text: swelling of the lymph nodes due to infiltration of cancerous cells

shortDefinitions: spread of tumour, cells, etc. into tissue or organ

definitions: permeation of a liquid into something by filtration

examples.text: improved water infiltration into the soil
this mosaic was in danger of being lost because of the infiltration of rainwater

shortDefinitions: permeation of liquid into something by filtration

definitions: the process of gradually permeating or becoming a part of something

examples.text: the gradual infiltration of Boyce's music into the national consciousness

shortDefinitions: process of gradually permeating or becoming part of something
